title: Offset Calculation Function
description:
DEG_TO_DIR calculates a direction (0 .360 degrees) into to compass rea￾dings. At the input DEG the direction in degrees is available (0 = North, 90
= East, 180 = South and 270 = West ). The output represents the directi￾on as String NNE. With the input N the maximum length of the direction in￾dication is limited. When N = 1, only in the 4 cardinal directions N, E, S, W
dissolved. If N = 2 between each another direction is inserted: NE, SE, SW,
NW. At N = 3 are also directions as NNO ... are dissolved, with N = 3 a to￾tal of 16 directions are evaluated. The input L allows the switching of the
languages defned in the language setup. 0L = 0 means Default Langua￾ge, a number > 0 is one of the predefned languages. more info about the
pre-defned data types can be found at CONSTANTS_LANGUAGE.
name: OFFSET2

input.name: X
input.description: The primary input value that may receive an offset.

input.name: O1
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_1.

input.name: O2
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_2.

input.name: O3
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_3.

input.name: O4
input.description: Flag indicating whether to add Offset_4.

input.name: D
input.description: Flag that determines if the default value should be returned instead of the adjusted X.

input.name: Offset_1
input.description: Value to be added if O1 is true.

input.name: Offset_2
input.description: Value to be added if O2 is true.

input.name: Offset_3
input.description: Value to be added if O3 is true.

input.name: Offset_4
input.description: Value to be added if O4 is true.

input.name: default
input.description: The default value returned if D is true.

output.name: OFFSET2
output.description: The calculated offset value which is either the adjusted X or the default value.

return_value.description: Returns the final computed offset value.
